title: “One Does Not Know Where an Insight Will Come From” | People I (Mostly) Admire: Kerwin Charles
description: The dean of Yale’s School of Management grew up in a small village in Guyana. During his unlikely journey, he has researched video-gaming habits, communicable disease, and why so many African-Americans haven’t had the kind of success he’s had. Steve Levitt talks to Charles about his parents’ encouragement, his love of Sports Illustrated, and how he talks to his American-born kids about the complicated history of Blackness in America.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
